Apple___Apple_scab.description: Apple scab is a fungal disease affecting leaves and fruit, caused by *Venturia inaequalis*.
symptoms: Olive-green or brown spots on leaves
Scabby lesions on fruit
Premature leaf drop in severe cases
solutions: Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruit

Apple___Black_rot.description: Black rot is a fungal disease caused by *Botryosphaeria obtusa*, affecting fruit, leaves, and branches.
symptoms: Small, circular brown spots on leaves
Fruit rot starting at the blossom end
Cankers on branches

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Cedar apple rust is a fungal disease caused by *Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae*, requiring both apple and cedar trees to complete its life cycle.
symptoms: Yellow-orange spots on apple leaves
Raised, orange lesions on the underside of leaves
Galls on cedar trees

Apple___healthy.description: Healthy apple trees show no signs of disease or pest infestation.
symptoms: Dark green leaves without spots
Normal fruit development without lesions
solutions: Monitor for pests and diseases regularly

Blueberry___healthy.description: Healthy blueberry plants exhibit vigorous growth and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Dark green leaves without spots or discoloration
Firm, ripe blueberries
solutions: Prune annually to promote air circulation

Cherry___Powdery_mildew.description: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease caused by *Podosphaera clandestina*, resulting in a white, powdery growth on leaves and fruit.
symptoms: White, powdery coating on leaves and stems
Stunted growth
Distorted leaves

Cherry___healthy.description: Healthy cherry trees display vibrant green foliage and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Dark green leaves without powdery residue
Healthy-looking cherries
Vigorous growth

Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_sp.description: Cercospora leaf spot (also known as gray leaf spot) is a fungal disease that affects corn plants.
symptoms: Grayish-brown spots on leaves, starting on lower leaves and progressing upwards
Rectangular lesions parallel to leaf veins
Severe infections can lead to premature leaf death
solutions: Crop rotation to reduce inoculum levels
Fungicide applications (e.g., strobilurins, triazoles) in severe cases

Corn___Common_rust.description: Common rust is a fungal disease caused by *Puccinia sorghi* that affects corn plants.
symptoms: Elongated, reddish-brown pustules on leaves
Pustules rupture to release reddish-brown spores
Severe infections can reduce photosynthetic capacity
solutions: Fungicide applications (e.g., strobilurins, triazoles) if necessary
Crop rotation and removal of infected plant debris

Corn___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Northern leaf blight is a fungal disease caused by *Exserohilum turcicum* that affects corn plants.
symptoms: Long, elliptical, gray-green to tan lesions on leaves
Lesions often start on lower leaves and progress upwards
Severe infections can cause significant yield losses
solutions: Use of resistant or tolerant corn hybrids
Fungicide applications (e.g., strobilurins, triazoles) if warranted

Corn___healthy.description: Healthy corn plants exhibit vigorous growth and dark green leaves without signs of disease or stress.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Robust stalk growth
No signs of lesions or pustules

Grape___Black_rot.description: Black rot is a fungal disease caused by *Guignardia bidwellii* that affects grapevines.
symptoms: Small, reddish spots on young leaves
Circular lesions on fruit that eventually turn black and hard
Infected berries shrivel and become mummified

Grape___Esca (Black_Measles).description: Esca (black measles) is a complex grapevine disease associated with several fungal pathogens.
symptoms: Leaf spots with a reddish-brown border
Interveinal chlorosis (yellowing) on leaves
Dark streaks in the wood
Berry shrivel and necrosis
solutions: Application of wound protectants after pruning
No effective curative treatments are available

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Isariopsis leaf spot (also known as leaf blight) is a fungal disease caused by *Isariopsis clavispora*.
symptoms: Small, circular spots on leaves with a whitish center and dark border
Spots may merge to form larger lesions
Premature leaf drop in severe cases

Grape___healthy.description: Healthy grapevines exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking grapes
No signs of lesions or discoloration
solutions: Pruning to maintain vine structure and health

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Huanglongbing (HLB), also known as citrus greening, is a bacterial disease caused by *Candidatus Liberibacter spp.*, transmitted by the Asian citrus psyllid.
symptoms: Asymmetric blotchy mottling of leaves
Yellow shoots
Small, misshapen, and bitter fruit
Decline in tree health
solutions: Control of Asian citrus psyllids with insecticides
In severe cases, removal of infected trees

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot is a disease caused by the bacterium *Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni* that affects peach, plum, and other stone fruit trees.
symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves
Shot-hole appearance on leaves (spots fall out)
Small, dark lesions on fruit that may crack
Cankers on twigs and branches
solutions: Proper sanitation to remove infected plant debris

Peach___healthy.description: Healthy peach trees exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking peaches
No signs of lesions or discoloration
solutions: Pruning to maintain tree structure and health

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot is a disease caused by *Xanthomonas euvesicatoria* that affects pepper plants.
symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit
Spots turn brown and may have a yellow halo
Defoliation in severe cases
Sunken, irregular lesions on fruit
solutions: Use of disease-free seeds and transplants

Pepper,_bell___healthy.description: Healthy pepper plants exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking peppers
No signs of lesions or discoloration

Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight is a fungal disease caused by *Alternaria solani* that affects potato plants.
symptoms: Small, dark brown lesions on leaves with concentric rings (target-like appearance)
Lesions may enlarge and merge
Yellowing of surrounding tissue
Defoliation in severe cases

Potato___Late_blight.description: Late blight is a devastating disease caused by the oomycete *Phytophthora infestans* that affects potato and tomato plants.
symptoms: Irregular, water-soaked lesions on leaves, often with a white, cottony growth on the underside
Rapid spread of the disease under cool, humid conditions
Rotting of tubers
Foul odor
solutions: Proper sanitation and disposal of infected plants
Monitor weather conditions and disease forecasts

Potato___healthy.description: Healthy potato plants exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant tuber production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
No signs of lesions or discoloration
Robust stem growth

Raspberry___healthy.description: Healthy raspberry plants exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking raspberries
No signs of lesions or discoloration
solutions: Pruning to maintain plant structure and health

Soybean___healthy.description: Healthy soybean plants exhibit vigorous growth and abundant pod production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking soybeans
No signs of lesions or discoloration

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that affects squash plants.
symptoms: White or gray powdery spots on leaves and stems
Spots may spread to cover entire leaves
Leaves may turn yellow and dry out
solutions: Application of fungicides (e.g., sulfur, neem oil)
Watering plants at the base to avoid wetting foliage

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Leaf scorch is a fungal disease caused by *Diplocarpon earlianum* that affects strawberry plants.
symptoms: Small, circular, purple to reddish-brown spots on leaves
Spots may enlarge and merge, causing the leaves to appear scorched
Reduced fruit yield and quality

Strawberry___healthy.description: Healthy strawberry plants exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking strawberries
No signs of lesions or discoloration

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot is a disease caused by *Xanthomonas perforans* that affects tomato plants.
symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit
Spots turn brown and may have a yellow halo
Lesions on fruit may be slightly raised and scabby
solutions: Use of disease-free seeds and transplants

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Early blight is a fungal disease caused by *Alternaria solani* that affects tomato plants.
symptoms: Small, dark brown lesions on leaves with concentric rings (target-like appearance)
Lesions may enlarge and merge
Yellowing of surrounding tissue
Defoliation in severe cases

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Late blight is a devastating disease caused by the oomycete *Phytophthora infestans* that affects tomato and potato plants.
symptoms: Irregular, water-soaked lesions on leaves, often with a white, cottony growth on the underside
Rapid spread of the disease under cool, humid conditions
Fruit rot
Foul odor
solutions: Proper sanitation and disposal of infected plants
Monitor weather conditions and disease forecasts

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Leaf mold is a fungal disease caused by *Passalora fulva* that affects tomato plants, especially in humid environments.
symptoms: Pale green or yellowish areas on the upper surface of older leaves
Grayish-purple mold on the lower surface of leaves
Severe infections can lead to defoliation
solutions: Water plants at the base to avoid wetting foliage

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Septoria leaf spot is a fungal disease caused by *Septoria lycopersici* that affects tomato plants.
symptoms: Small, circular spots on leaves with a dark border and a light tan center
Numerous spots can cause yellowing and defoliation
Spots may also appear on stems and petioles

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Spider mites are tiny pests that can infest tomato plants, causing damage to leaves.
symptoms: Fine webbing on leaves
Small, yellow or white spots on leaves
Stippled or bronzed appearance of leaves
Reduced plant vigor
solutions: Strong spray of water to dislodge mites

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Target spot is a fungal disease caused by *Corynespora cassiicola* that affects tomato plants.
symptoms: Small, circular spots on leaves with concentric rings (target-like appearance)
Lesions may enlarge and merge
Defoliation in severe cases
Fruit lesions are less common

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Tomato mosaic virus (ToMV) is a viral disease that affects tomato plants.
symptoms: Mottled or mosaic pattern on leaves
Stunted growth
Distorted or curled leaves
Reduced fruit yield and quality
solutions: Use of virus-free seeds and transplants

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV) is a viral disease transmitted by whiteflies that affects tomato plants.
symptoms: Upward curling and yellowing of leaves
Stunted growth
Reduced fruit set
Bushy appearance
solutions: Row covers to protect young plants

Tomato___healthy.description: Healthy tomato plants exhibit vigorous growth, dark green leaves, and abundant fruit production.
symptoms: Uniform green color of leaves
Healthy-looking tomatoes
No signs of lesions or discoloration
